description:
Delicious, delicious, delicious! Very good service except one thing. No one that works there greets or acknowledges you the first time they see you. So you may have to hang out at the register for w bit while you wait to make your oder. This happened both times I visited. So you'll wait to place your order. Then you can seat yourself. You just kind of tell them where you'll be. Or they'll look for you. It's not a super huge place.
   The food is delicious! Totally worth not being greeted or acknowledged right away. We ordered a pierna enchilada torta Jr. Size. That's the most popular torta there, and it's totally delicious! Pulled pork and enchilada sauce. The taco with the huitlacoche was even delicious. It's a really big taco served on a tortilla. There's no meat in it. It's like the huitlacoche is the meat. But that taco is super delicious. We also ordered the carne asada torta. Jr. Size. Also very delicious. The meat is well seasoned, the cheese is amazing. And they didn't put too much beans or any of the tortas. It was like the beans were just used for a spread. 
     On my first visit a month ago, I got the piña colada smoothie. You may think it's pricey, but that too was super delicious! I mean I have never had a piña colada smoothie that good before! Creamy and delicious! 
     Once you get in well and get your food ordered the service is excellent! The waitresses are very attentive, and bring everything you could want or need before you can even ask for it. 
    The restroom is small, but very clean. So don't hesitate to use it if you're one of these people that hates using public bathrooms. You'll be pleasantly surprised. 
       Parking on a Sunday usually is easy. You can park for free at the meters on Sunday. You may have to park a block or two away, but it's never too far. 
      I will come here every visit I have to San Francisco.
author: Zoe S.

description: Of course they make a great Torta... but did you know they serve up a solid Chilaquiles? Ask for a bit of spice in their Red sauce and you will not be disappointed!
author: David B.

description:
It sounds like the most un-Latino thing on their menu, but the Turkey Torta is really good. So are a lot of the other Tortas. It's got an old school cafeteria/diner feel inside, and the staff is friendly and efficient. One of my favorite places on 24th.

ProTip: Don't order at the register. Sit down at a table, there are menus there, and someone will come take your order.
author: Rusty H.

description:
Pierna Enchilada, pulled pork sandwich, on some list of Best sandwich but we didn't really like it. It's gooey and with mushy meat and the ratio of other ingredients is off. I think there was a bit of cheese in there and maybe  some chilies ?

The people working there were sweet and food was prompt

They gave me a sample of the cucumber lime Agua Fresca of the day and it was fantastic
author: Foodlover B.

description: A 20 minutes ride from my hotel was not going to separate me and this foodie paradise. Delicious authentic Mexico City style food.  Their tinga is absolutely yummy on a quesadilla. I also tried the pierna torta which was very good, just a bit salty but nothing to complain. I will definitely come back.
author: Walid A.

description: Good place to eat if u are craving for REAL MEXICAN QUESADILLAS AND TORTAS. Cubana torta, pierna enchilada and I can't forget their tinga quesadillas it reminds me the ones from Mexico !!
author: Myra M.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised how much I liked this place. From the outside, it's very unassuming. But once inside, the decor is very unique. Some parts looks like an old style diner, others looks very modern, at least The lighting. 

I had a number 14. I couldn't tell you what the proper name is on the menu, but basically it was a hot dog and egg sandwich. It was awesome.

The service was quick and the waitress was very nice.
I can't wait to go back.
author: Darryl L.

description:
This is a Mexican restaurant specializing in cuisine from the state of Puebla- their selection of tortas is their take on a toasted sandwich.  

Do try the beef milanesa and the pierna enchilada (pulled pork) for juicy deliciousness. 

Ask for Habanero peppers for some real heat, if you can handle it.

Try the hot Champurrado... you won't have many opportunities to come by this drink and it's not always done right. This place makes it not too watery and not too sweet, so it tastes like a creamy cinnamon hot chocolate. So good!
author: Mitzi G.

description: Prices for breakfast are a little excessive. $15.95 for huevos con nopales.   3 stars for the prices.
author: Mia G.

description: Really good torta!! Went in on our way to a show on a whim. So happy we walked in here! Got the carnitas torta and the pierna enchilada torta. Both really fresh. The cheese with avocado accompanied the carnitas so well. Delicious! Will definitely go again next time we are in the mission.
author: Vaiya S.

description:
Love this place Torta central! The Al Pastor Torta is amazing - the bread is very different and has multiple spreads on it. There are multiple sizes you can depending how hungry you are - from the a full size to a medium/small size. 

Go on a sunny day and its perfect to grab a table outside and soak in that vitamin D. 

Also plus they have vegetarian options (calling all vegetarians out there). The vegetarian poblano pepper tortas are really good.
author: Kunal T.

description: Massive sandwiches and a wide variety of interesting flavors. I had the chorizo potato and it was tasty and as big as my torso. I eat alot of it was easily 2 big meals for about 10 bucks. Its a bit away from the usual bart area of the mission I tend to be in but well worth the trip just come hungry.
author: Sean G.

description: This has to be the best Torta that I have ever had to date.  It was a monster......... My boss picked them up for the whole crew, and it weighed in about 2 pounds.  It was simply delicious.  I have not been to the actual store, but I will be now.  In the mean time, I am happy with someone on my crew picking up the food for us.
author: Paul G.

description: I had the regular-sized torta with pierna enchilada (pulled pork) and it was great! The bread was a bit too crispy for me, but still tasty. The topping were all awesome and flavorful and plentiful, and their pierna speciality meat was super tasty. Chill, cheap, fast, and tasty; what more could you ask for?!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Just to give an all around review this place is trash. To start they took forever to take our order. After they did we waited there for an hour to find out they hadn't ever started to make our food. We eventually had to leave as we had better things to do then to wait for food that was never going to be made. If you are in a hurry this is not the place to go.
author: Bella F.

description: Ok the Tortas here are amazing! Bread is fresh and pressed panini style with some righteous Al Pastor.  The crew put on half of an avacado with cheese and red onion.  There salsa is fresh and full of flavor.  This San Diego boy was impressed with food this good in Nor Cal!  Great service and friendly servers and cooks!  I will be back with my friends and family!  Thank you La Torta Gorda!
author: Ryan H.

description:
How to LA TORTA GORDA: 

1) Grab a seat and watch the soccer game on the screen with the regulars.

2) Order a Torta (OBVIOUSLY)

I tried the Pierna Enchilada Torta and while the pork was flavorful the only other thing on the sandwich was queso fresco. (Where'd the avocado go?) :P

The "junior" size torta was fine for me but if you're hangry get the regular size. Also, chips don't come with the tortas so plan accordingly. If you like the spicy, be sure to try their salsas.

3) Question the Food Network

Although I had no problem chowing down on my torta, I don't know that it was "Food Network #2 Sandwich" hype worthy.

And finally...

4) Be glad that there are still places like La Torta Gorda in the Mission!
author: Amy C.

description:
I had the huitlacoche. (insert bomb emoji here)
But now I see that they have champurrado and I'm bummed that I didn't have some. Well, it's summer in SF. Not the June, July, August kind of SF summer with foggy days. It's actually in the 70s today. Maybe champurrado wasn't in the cards. 

But the quesadilla was la verdad.
author: Eric S.

description: Best torta I've ever tried! This place is a MUST if ever in town. I highly recommend the Pierna Enchilada Torta.
author: Edgar H.

description: Over price and not good, been here before and loved the Torta. This time it was flavorless and over priced $24 for a Torta and an agua fresca. Not coming back here anymore.
author: Juan M.

description: One of the best in the city.. a quick and easy stop. The tortas are bomb!! I always get a small chicken grilled torta, if you get a large you most likely won't finish it.they also serve other foods and Latin dinner plates but the torta is a must. Very friendly and every time I order for pick up it's hot and ready.
author: Jay V.

description: I ordered 4 Tortas 3 Carne Asada  1 huevo Con chorizo. The Carne Asada  was full of fat chewy and  flavorless. The Torta came with either Jalapeños or chipotle chile. I chose jalapeños. They weren't stingy with the chile that came from a Can. The bread was hard and dry. So disappointed. My daughter ordered the Huevos Con chorizo. Very bland. I paid $75.00 for 4 Tortas a coffee and 3 apple sodas. Very overpriced. And the food was flavorless.
author: Hilda L.

description: Went here one night with a friend and we ordered two sandwiches to share. The carne asada torta was on the SF 7x7 Big Eats list and the menu touted the pierna enchilada as being the food networks top 5 sandwich, so we had to order both. Both were delicious. I preferred the pork to the steak, but that is typical of my tastes. We also had mexican hot chocolates, which were weird to drink with our spicy sandwiches, but it was all good, none the less. Would go back if I was in the area again!
author: La Tache T.

description: Guacamole had very little flavor.  The verde chicken enchiladas were the worst I've ever had!  The sauce was bitter and rich, the chicken was dry as could be, and the tortillas were tough to cut through.  The black bean and rice were good... but really that was the only likable thing and not hard to get wrong.
author: Melissa W.

description: My friend and I had late lunch there. We ordered their signature #12 Pierna Enchilada, #7 Hawaiian (smoked ham and pineapple) and mango madness! They were all excellent!!! Since this is a michelin recommended restaurant, i had a bit expectation when driving there! It ended up surprised me by excellent bread, generous portion and friendly service! Everything was on point! I'll definitely come back!
author: Lily M.

description:
FOOD: These are the real deal tortas.

I've had the pierna enchilada torta a couple times (junior--and I am known for my appetite), and it bursts with flavor. I especially love to drench it in the hot sauce :). 

The mole torta was delicious, but in retrospect I would have preferred the mole as a dish and the pierna enchilada every time. No surprise it was named the #2 sandwich in America by Food Network! Lol gentrification

SERVICE: Super friendly! 

AMBIANCE: Good mix of locals and tourists. There are families that hang out on the back patio, men who come to watch futbol, and hipster couples here for the sandwich experience. No group overwhelms another, so it's basically a perfect microcosm of the Mission :).
author: Helen W.

description: Excellent! Get the vegetarian poblano pepper torts! It's delicious! Clean, excellent and friendly service with outdoor seating. You can't go wrong here. Owner is also the top chef and his recommendations were spot on!
author: Kristina W.

description: Was looking for places in the city with good tortas, and this one was one of the first options to pop up. Glad I tried it out! The large tortas are pretty huge, and the junior ones are definitely enough to fill you up. They're packed with ingredients and very flavorful, and all reasonably priced! Will definitely come by to try some of the other combinations (I had to try the famed pierna enchilada, which was great but one of the messiest options, I think!)
author: Delia Z.

description:
This place is fantastic! 

The food is amazing, the service is great! The staff all took pride in this establishment. 

Seriously stop in!!
author: Terrance H.

description:
Awesome tortas that are gigantic, even for the junior sized version.  It is not often that I am in this area, but I would come back here if I was craving Mexican food.  

It was a little strange when I first walked in.  I was not sure if I needed to order first or wait to be seated.  So for the record, find a table, they will bring you a menu.  

What did I learn today?  Parking is going to be your greatest limitation in getting here.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Great food, we were working in the area this morning. Stopped by to have breakfast. 

   I Had the Chilaquiles with scrambled eggs. With the red sauce. Really delicious, they make homemade tortillas.

  My buddy had two chile reyenos with sunny side up eggs on top. Great customer service. 

We even ordered a few Tortas to go, for an early lunch later in the day.

You wouldn't think of a Mexican restaurant having good breakfast but they do. You have to give it a try.
author: Erik H.

description:
The husband and I stopped here for a quick bite in an otherwise difficult stretch of neighborhood to eat in. We were attending an event at the nearby Brava Theater and didn't have a ton of time. I had snacked a lot beforehand, so I ordered the guacamole and chips. The guac was out of this world: good and fresh.

Apparently this place had been recognized by the Food Network for having a phenomenal sandwich, which neither of us ordered, regrettably. I can't recall exactly what the husband did order (I want to say some kind of taco), but he reported it was very good. On the tables were some homemade sauces: a red one that must have been chipotle and a green one that seemed to be mostly jalapeno and cilantro. I loved the green sauce. The chips were thin and perfect.

They sell breakfast as well (there's not a hangover in this world that chilaquiles cannot cure), which I am sure I will never be around to taste but looks great. The interior is pretty diner-y and small, but comfortable. Worth a stop if you're nearby and hungry.
author: Sherry B.

description: Did not like the service and the Carnitas tortas I had I actually had more beans that meat will definitely not come back
author: Daniel B.

description: Delicious food! Carne asada torta is my favorite. Regular size is a big portion so if you're not that hungry go for a junior size
author: Jason B.

description: Loved this place took my whole family here... we had everything from the Tortas to the huevos rancheros to the chicken mole ... EVERYTHING... was absolutely delicious... and we are definitely picky as hell when it comes to Mexican food ... especially my father but we all loved it ... definitely coming back...
author: Antonio C.

description:
I have eaten here before and it was good. Not today. My chorizo and potato torta had VERY little chorizo, a few potatoes and lots of lettuce. The bigger issue was #51 Tlacoyos al Albanil, "a  grilled tortilla stuffed with black beans, topped with cheese, onions, salsa, avocado and eggs". Not. The tortilla made with blue corn masa was not fully cooked and was hard and not tasty. There were no black beans, no salsa, 3 thin slices of avocado, a bit of chopped onion and fortunately 2 eggs. All for $8.95 (half order size). When we mentioned the problems to the owner he made said they had made substitutions ??!! They substituted food for empty real estate on the plate. And when I asked about the missing salsa from the dish, he pointed to the salsa on the table. He was very defensive and stored off. Not a good sign. If he was confident in what they were serving, he would of stayed and discussed the problem. When we asked for the check he said "no charge". I would of preferred a good meal that I pay for rather than a free bad one. 
Also prices are high. $14.95 for Huevos Rancheros for a diner is very expensive.

In fairness, I have eaten here before and it was good. Perhaps a new cook that isn't up to the task. Try the restaurant but call them on it if you don't get what they advertise.
author: Eric P.

description:
Came with a very large group for lunch and sat outside. Nice tables in the back on a sunny day. Tortas are HUGE! Regular size is easily two meals. I had tacos and home fries which were both wonderful.

Service was kind and gracious.

No chips sadly but salsa on the table is flavorful. Prices are reasonable and menu is extensive.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Very nice staff, good vibes with indoor and outdoor seating available. According to posters inside the restaurant, this place apparently has one of the top 5 sandwiches in the U.S., referring to their pulled pork torta. So, curious, I had to try it.

The bread was lovely, and the sauce that the meat marinates in is definitely tasty. The regular size is definitely enough. But I'm gonna be honest and say that I've made better pulled pork from a crockpot. The pork just didn't seem to be as tender as it could be, and half the sandwich wasn't saucy enough. 

Don't get me wrong, it's a good sandwich! I just might not come in with such high expectations.
author: Andrew T.

description: I love this place!  Great tortas and everything else is authentic too.  Love the champurrado...if you've never heard of it and want something hot to drink, order it, trust me.  The "Pierna Enchilada" torta is amazing...won an award on the Food Channel for Americas #2 best sandwich.  Their quesadillas are tasty, especially the "flor de calabaza".
author: A B.

description: Gross. I could only take 2 bites of my torta. Beef had no flavor and it was smothered in cheese and something horrible. My GF took 5 bites of her enchiladas and then it went into compost bin. I was surprised. Menu sounds legit but tastes were awful. Don't do it.
author: Rude G.

description:
I got to check this place out on election night. First time eating there and was not sure how to order. I had to approach the counter to figure it out and same when it came time to pay. Not much of an issue, but they should acknowledge customers as they walk in. 
The food was made quickly and I had the Pierna Enchilada which was simply delicious. I highly recommend it.
author: Andy S.

description:
SPOILED MEAT ALERT!

This rating is based on the owner's reaction to my complaint. Here's what happened:

I bought a "milanesa de res" torta. I take the first bite and the smell and taste of the meat was disgusting. As a former sever at a steakhouse, I know when meat has gone bad from 3 miles away. 

So I emailed the owner and he demands evidence. I emailed him back asking him what kind of evidence he's looking for (this is 2 days ago) and I still haven't heard back. I understand he might think someone is trying to hustle him. Then I realized this locale's health score is 75.

I will post pictures of the meat soon so he can believe me. Stay tune.
author: Hector M.

description:
I ate lunch here and they have the best guacomole OMG.  It was seasoned perfectly with cilantro and just right on the jalepeno...the consistency was perfect still chunky not to smooth and the chips were perfect dipping chips they didn't break while scooping a bite.  OMG it was so good!!!

I had a chicken sorta it was good not what I was expected in terms of flavor I thought  it was going to be a little more spicy and less tomato sauce.  It was just a little to drippy for me.  I ate but that would not be my first choice if I were to visit again I would try the asada next time.  

Its are really nice place small great atmosphere great place for lunch!!!  Check it out...
author: Dona S.

description:
Quaint and classy dinner vibes at this monster torts spot, and one of the few places to serve tasty tasty huitlacoche (corn fungus).

Tortas are huge and tasty, their carnitas is a more wet version compared to the torta place down the street. Don't sleep on the huitlacoche tacos though, sweet, nutty with a stewed mushroom texture. They're hard to find and it's a nice change of pace from your standard Mission Mexican.
author: Patrick T.

description:
Met my daughter here for lunch today; I ordered the Al Pastor Torta and it was amazing.  Seriously.  Lovely, crusty bread; avocado; beans; queso fresco; jalapenos...  Just an amazing, delicious sandwich, all the way around, from the meat to the bread to the add-ons.

Tortas come in full and "junior" portions; the junior would have been plenty, but I managed to consume the entire full-sized sandwich.  And I have no regrets (except that I came on a weekday, so now must sit at my desk at work, half asleep, for the next several hours).

The salsas are as exceptional as the tortas; I was especially fond of the chipotle, as I demonstrated by compulsively squirting some on every bite.  Literally.

The place is charming (we sat on the back patio) and clean, and the staff is really friendly and accommodating.  I'll be recommending this restaurant to everyone!
author: Teresa G.

description: Amazing food!! The service is average, but the food made up for it. As soon as we walked in no one directed us on how ordering works; we had to walk up to someone and ask if we can sit anywhere. The waitress finally came and she was pretty nice on explaining the menu. The Tortas were scrumptious and the Jr. is a decent size, but if you are really hungry go for regular-it will be worth it!!
author: Karina S.

description:
LORD people. Starving in my office which has zero yummy food options.  Doordash tells me I can get a torta delivered!!  Yeah it's nine am, but TORTA! I ordered the pierna enchilada (pulled pork). I got a junior size and still could only eat half.  Delish!  Messy and oozy and so flavorful. Yummmm.  For some reason they also sent a side of hash browns which were great--soft side but crispy out. Mmmm.  Maybe because it's breakfast time? Dunno. But yum. Not very much avocado though -- which for me is fine but I could see some feeling a bit cheated. And they sent a couple of hot sauces which is vital for me.  
So going back.
author: julie a.

description: Got food poisoning from there Torta de Milanesa. The milanesa was chicken milanesa. The sad part is, it was really tasty. Unfortunately no matter how good something is you can't bypass it making you sick....
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Atmosphere: relaxed, neighborhood, diner style spot. This is where regulars come and never leave. It's like going into your grandma's kitchen. 

Service: Attentive and patient. 

Food: fantastic, fulfilling, great for vegetarians. Every menu item is solid. My favorite was the chicken torta and huevos rancheros. 

Drink: excellent smoothies, made with fresh fruits and vegetables.
author: Nina G.

description:
Prompt and attentive service I also like the fact the the waitress/cashier  checked twice to see if everything was ok at my table

Orther a qhitlacoche quesadilla 
It was perfect balance of flavors  the  fresh  epazote the huitlacoche ratio cheese where there 
  the corn tortilla freshly made just for the quesadilla 


I also ordered the days special 
Posted on a board on sidewalk 

" chicken  Pepian  " skip it !
Don't get me wong I know that this place is known for their tortas and some of their Poblano especialties but this dish was just mediocre at best the souce has some potential but the chicken tasted like it had been boiled just in plain water and it tasted as such bland boiled chicken
author: N. A.

description: Ive been coming here for the Sopes for yeas. No ones sopes can come close to this spot. Fresh avocado and shredded chicken mmmmmmm
author: Terese V.

description:
We went to La Torta Gorda today for lunch. We went because it was listed as one of the top 38 essential restaurants in San Francisco.

I got the carne asado torta and it was delicious. I recommend it to anybody who is confused about what to order on the menu. You won't go wrong with this one. I was also hoping to drink a horchata that I saw in one of the pictures on yelp. Unfortunately, they do not serve horchatas. 

There were six in our group and from the moment we ordered until the moment we got our food we waited about 15 maybe 20 minutes. This is not gourmet dining so I was surprised it took so long. Do not go to this restaurant if you are low on time and need a quick meal. 

There is seating in the back for up to 20, 25 people. The staff is friendly and the guacamole is delicious. 

When you order, keep in mind that most tortas are good enough for two people to eat. 

I give this restaurant four stars simply because it took way too long to get our food.
author: Drago F.

description:
There are few times in life where a place is just so shockingly offensively perfect. Better than perfect. This is literally a 10 star breakfast place. 

Such a contrast to the average food and long lines at St Francis Fountain next door. They have a giant beautiful back patio in the sun. The breakfast was perfect. Best hashbrowns Ive had in my life.

And it was completely empty in the patio area. Get wise San Francisco!
author: Matt W.

description:
First time I ever tried this place was at a house party when the host ordered from them to cater the party. We even got to meet the owner that night and since then this place has been amazing.

I love the pulled pork tostada that comes with avocado. I always order to go and enjoy at home. I pay $1 more for 3 more tostadas since 3 is never enough for the amount of meat they give you. 

It's so delicious!!
author: Joanne K.

description:
I was hoping this place would be bomb as .... but alas, it was just plain okay.

It looks real cute from the outside--a colorful little diner with posters on how they have the #2 best sandwich in the U.S. according to Food Network. And the staff inside was super sweet.

My friend and I both ordered the famous sandwich--the pierna enchilada torta with pulled pork. Reasonable price at under $11 for a refular sized one. Jalapenos, mayo, Mexican cheese, pulled pork...sounds great, right? The flavors were all very bland though. If it weren't for their awesome red sauce, I would not have kept eating. The bread was also very nice. #2 in the nation though? Nawww.
author: Michelle N.

description: Tried the Pierna Enchilada torta...amazing and affordable.
author: Kyle L.

description:
All time favorite place when I want a Torta. I have to admit sometimes when I go I order two, one to eat there and one for home. The hot sauce is amazing, I definitely horde it and ask for extra when I'm on the go.

They have juices that are freshly made. The vampiro is my fav, which is beets, orange, and something else I can't remember.

I've tried the champarrado, which is yum when it's cold out and I've also tried brunch here, but this is always, always my go to when I'm in the area and want a torta-fix. Sometimes twice a week.

If you haven't tried it, it's a must. I take everyone here when they visit. lol
author: Mellisa A.

description:
After 26 hours of travelling and flights, a good nights sleep and a massive hunger the next day, there was only one thing going to satisfy my needs and that was a massive breakfast of homely,  filling Mexican food. 

Staying with friends in the Mission district I did manage to bat away the idea that we should go for 'modern Californian' as I was in the mood for chilled out and getting very fat. And getting fat was what I did! 

This place is like a diner with a long service counter, probably seating for 50 and an outdoor patio. I've got to say that the Mexican on offer in SF is a billion times more varied and exciting than back home in Manchester (UK) and looking through the menu left me with more questions than answers.

After a bit of help from my Cali friends and a bit of menu decoding later, I plumped for the black bean filled tacos with spicy sauce, avocado and 2 fried eggs. I have to say that this was probably one of the tastiest breakfasts I've ever had with the Mexican food being as authentic and spicy as I hoped and the fresh runny yellow eggs just running into all the stodge.

Incredible food, incredibly satisfied - if I'm back down the mission then I'm going again!
author: Jonny Q.

description:
The Al Pastor torta is fantastic! Make sure you try their house sauce, I think it's Chipotle? Super smokey with a strong flavor that goes great on the Tortas.

The staff is always very friendly even though they are usually slammed when I go there.

Great list of Tortas to choose from and it's a solid breakfast option on 24th when a lot of other places have long lines. 

Also a good spot to get fresh juice! I get the Vampiro.
author: York G.

description:
We tried this place early on Friday evening.  The place was nearly empty, not a good sign.
We seated ourselves and very nice server took our order.
We both ordered melon agua fresca.
I ordered a junior carne asada torta while my partner ordered a junior torta cubana.  The sandwiches came promptly and were hot.
I liked my torta just fine although I have had better tortas at other places in the Mission District.  My partner agreed.  He said his torta was good, but he's had better.
Hard telling why the tortas were not better.  Perhaps a little more seasoning would help.
author: Philip C.

description:
I really had no idea what to expect. These lists of items to get always ends up being an adventure to say the least. 

Ordered a pierna enchilada on postmates (love being able to get delivery) and I definitely didn't get what I expected. When I think of an enchilada, I think of a tortilla wrapped around a filling and drenched in a sauce...instead I got something that looked like a sandwich with sauce provided. Just so unexpected! I'm okay with pouring my own sauce, but it was SPICY!

By the way, a junior is plenty for one person. I could have made that into two meals too if I hadn't eaten it so late in the night so I was freaking hungry. 

Protip: get the junior size for a regular sized meal.
author: Nina Y.

description:
With Best Sandwiches of the Mission (http://www.seriouseats.com/2013/10/the-nine-best-sandwiches-period-in-the-missio.html) they had me at roasted poblano peppers, cheese and cheese for the Rajas con Queso. Considering my weakness for chile relleno this was really not fair. I'm not sure you could find a better sandwich for my target demographic of chile relleno lovers.

Weekday mornings the place is pretty quiet. Small clean joint with a long countertop. Friendly peeps. Relaxing atmosphere. Good start.

Of course the sandwich was yummy. And unlike any other sandwich I've had in terms of ingredients. But like I said, I'm the target demographic. If you aren't into chile relleno this might not be your thing. I got the jr size and I don't recommend getting the bigger one unless you're super hungry because in this case jr size is like a normal sized sandwich that you can finish for lunch.

I noticed some signs saying they were on the 7x7 list of things to eat so I asked them what sandwich it was for. Turns out it's the pierna enchilada. Though I said I would be back to try it seriously I'm not sure if I can resist ordering the Rajas Con Queso again.
author: Jean K.

description:
Amazing Mexican Diner food.

Go here instead of the St. Francis fountain a few blocks down.

Great service, strong coffee, tasty food and dim lighting. The tortas are amazing and so are the fresh made shakes.
author: Dennis A.

description: Yet another place that I found from the "20 Epic Sandwiches to Eat Before you Die." I had the Al Pastor Torta per the recommendation by the article. To be honest, I am not a fan of sweet and savory in the same sandwich (this sandwich had pork and pineapple), but wow, was it amazing! I have never had tortas before (ironic for a California native, especially one who loves his Mexican food, believe me, I know!), but after getting the Al Pastor, I came back here a number of times and got a different torta each time. I haven't tried anything else, although the other dishes, especially the breakfast items, look amazing! The staff is also super friendly. Truly an authentic Mexican restaurant that represents this part of the Mission district!
author: Kunal N.

description: Came in on a Friday afternoon to grab something quick to eat before my Uncle and I headed out to go hiking. We walked in and it wasn't to packed but there were a few people in there. The service was quick and easy - I picked the carnitas torta and it was delicious! The only thing that was a little irritating was the jalapenos that were hidden in the flavorful carnitas but I picked them out, no biggie. The bread was nice and toasty too! If I'm ever in the area I'll be sure to come back here then head over to the ice cream shop on the corner of the building.
author: Taylor H.

description: This is a very long over due review. This is one of our favorite places in the neighborhood , al pastor is one of my fav, either in a torta  or in a quesadilla ( made with handmade tortillas) they have tortas in 2 sizes which is great!  Delicious fresh licuados, lots of coffee , and a patio, perfect for weekends with the fam. They always do a micky mouse pancake for my son . The restaurant is family operated and you always see the owner on site working hard every day...
author: Karen P.

description: i feel like roosevelt tamale parlor overshadowed this place in our eyes, quite literally since we ate there several times but never noticed this fabulous little mexican diner next door with the most delicious pierna enchilada and aguas frescas.  the husband love the rajas con queso torta, and we are looking forward to trying the huitlacoche quesadillas, huevos rancheros, chilaquiles, etcetcetc. that is, if we can resist the tortas again!
author: Archana P.

description: Our favorite local Mexican joint on 24th. Breakfast and lunch foods are delicious, orange juice is freshly squeezed... They have a famous sandwich and I recommend getting the large and splitting with someone.
author: Michelle G.

description: Great restaurant offering tortas and other dishes. There's a patio in the rear with several umbrella covered tables. There's also a counter with lots of seats. Came here for Mother's Day in May and back because in the neighborhood. If it were closer to where I lived I'd frequent this place a few times a month.  I love the atmosphere and the service is excellent!
author: Becca D.

description: This place is absolutely killer. I have gone back again and again, and brought friends just to try the amazing food. I always get the ham and pineapple torta and it has never disappointed me. Cool thing is it's pretty cheap too for good food.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
I've only tried three of their Tortas but all of them were painfully delicious.

Actually I shamefully ate 2 1/2 tortas during a shift at work when I brought them to share but they were forgotten. 

Best. Mistake. Ever.

The cubana was good not best cubana I've had in the Mission but I give it a pass since I didn't get the SUPER cubana which would've been more comparable to the huge monster tortas that That's It Market made famous. If the super Cubana is bomb I'll probaby make this 5 stars.

I also got the Palmazo(?) which I've never tried before but I thought it was pretty good. had a bright red bread, loaded with chorizo and potatoes. Not my favorite carb on carb action but I enjoyed it and ate the hell out of it (Giggitty).

My absolute favorite which I wasn't expecting was the Raza con Queso. 
IT WAS FREAKING VEGETARIAN. I didn't really order this one for me but it was my favorite, the grilled chile and cheese had a meaty texture and balanced the sandwich really well.

One thing to note is DRENCH those tortas in their sauce without the sauce the tortas rest at 3 stars but saucing them up brings them up so much.

Toss some meat on that Raza con Queso and I think these guys will have something magical.
author: Jeff T.

description:
Breakfast.
Ordered an omellette - cardinal sin - they used cheese food instead of cheese (that kraft for those of you that dont know the difference)
My breakfast mate ordered chilaquiles - very meh.
author: Susannah R.

description:
LATIN-AMERICAN FOOD CRAWL IN THE MISSION: Pierna enchilada torta, champurrado

For the first stop in our Latin American food crawl through the Mission, my friends and I came to La Torta to try a delicious Mexican torta and a hot cup of champurrado. We split a pierna enchilada (pulled pork) torta and it was absolutely delicious. The bread was perfectly toasted while still being soft on the inside, the tortilla was fluffy and light, and the pork was so flavorful and tender. One torta is pretty big, about 6" x 4", so our group was able to easily split one and still have enough food to take the edge off our hunger without spoiling our appetites. 

The champurrado can be an acquired taste for those new to atoles, but is definitely worth getting if you love trying new things. Basically, it's a chocolate-flavored atole (a hot, masa-based drink) that's popular in Mexico and Central America. La Torta gives a rather generous amount in a big mug that will keep you warm on cold nights.

The staff here are super nice too. When we ordered just one torta and one cup of champurrado to split amongst 4 people, our waitress was understandably confused. (We made sure to come in the middle of the afternoon when there were few patrons.) When we explained that we were doing a food crawl, she made sure to cut up the torta into 4 even, individually wrapped pieces. We didn't even have to ask her! She and the rest of the staff also wished us well when we were leaving, saying they hoped the rest of our food crawl was good. So nice. :)
author: Josephine L.

description: Wow, wish I tried this place years ago!  Great vegetarian tortas (two options to choose from--my favorite is the Rajas con Queso, but the straight vegetable one is also delicious).  Patio out back is nice and shady, service is quick, and the guys at the grill are impressive to watch.
author: Damian E.

description:
After reading all these good reviews, I figured I'd give this place a try. I am VERY familiar with tortas and I know what I like. 

I ordered a torta with carne asada, and was delighted to see how big the portions are here. It comes stuffed with meat, beans, avocado, jalpeños, and mayo. The bread was delicious, but the meat - not so much. 

They use what seems to be really cheap meat that is served in large slices instead of chopped up. I prefer tortas that have chopped up meat over these big pieces. But before you go judging me for pointing out the way they cut their meat, it's also about the quality. The meat just does not taste as good as it should. 

I wouldn't come here again unless I was starving or maybe I'll try something else next time. The torta was pretty damn pricey as well. I've NEVER in my life (until now) have paid $9 for a torta! This place reminded me of how much I miss the tortas back home and the cheap prices.
author: Arnold B.

description: I live down the street and this is a staple for me. The folks working here are so incredibly nice and sincere. The foood is amazing and one of the few places where you can get awesome chilaquiles any time of the day and huitlacoche (corn smut) quesadillas
author: Ami D.

description:
Some local friends brought me here for a very late breakfast after staying up to 4am drinking wine and catching up on old times.

This is the perfect hangover food place.  

The small tortas are the way to go, as it's already a lot of food.  So, there's your greasy hangover cure.

Add a Mango Madness smoothie, and you get your sugar boost for the day. Those smoothies are HUGE.  

Finish it off with a cup of coffee and you're ready to hit the town again.
author: Nina B.

description:
If you haven't been here before, shame on you.  It's a hidden gem, wonderful family ownership, and the most amazing Al Pastor Torta I've ever eaten.  I've tried other things here and have always been happy, but it is very difficult for me to pass up the Al Pastor Torta, with its creamy retried beans, fresh avocado, jalapeños, onions and surprisingly delightful pineapple. 
They are always friendly here, take great care of you and have a lot of pride in their food. Fresh made Agua fresca (best melon Agua fresca I've ever had).  

The portion size on the regular Torta is huge, so come hungry, or order the junior size of your appetite is on the small side.  

I've been here over 20 times and have not had a bad meal.
author: Spencer R.

description: Super good,fresh,and humble !! Lovely patio seating and superb food, I got the vegetarian torta with beans,queso fresco, tomatoes, and lots of avocado yum! All washed down with a delicious vampiro!! Their sized are huge I got the jr and was not able to finish the other half so more for later!! Very friendly staff, Highly recommend!!
author: Yvette S.

description:
I sampled the Cubana and the Pierna Enchilada Tortas. I opted for the juniors, but it was not a cost effective decision. You pay $7.75 for a junior and $10.75 for a regular, but the regular delivers 2.5 times the amount of food: perfect for eating half then and half later. 

The Pierna enchilada torta was one of the best Tortas I have had. Incredibly tender, moist pork in enchilada sauce served on a crispy bun. Wow, it was incredible and did not ever get boring. Ask for the bun extra crispy-- it really makes it even better. 

The Cubana was so-so. It was a monstrosity of pork, steak, hot dog, cheese, beans, and mayo-- but it never really had an identity. While the pork was a standout for the Pierna, the Cubana felt like a random mishmash with no theme. If I'm you, I opt for the Pierna or try a different item, but don't go for the Cubana.
author: Neal C.

description: Very bad food! Their menu is very weird and not like a typical Mexican restaurant. It is also unnecessarily expensive.
author: Mahesh S.

description: I ordered mole pueblano... i was craving it so bad at the time I was 7 months pregnant and you guys could imagine cravings. So I always ordered their tortas but this day I was craving mole so I ordered to go and once I was like 5 scoops of it I see some black spot in my spoon full , I look carefully and it was a Roach. I was so disgusted and upset. Ever since then I have not gone back and told my whole family n friends about the bad experience and that's nothing the owner is very rude. After this I didn't get an apology by anyone I got harassed by some horrible messages sent by the owner. How unprofessional
author: S C.

description: Like always, great food, tasty and nicely priced. We ordered the torta China Poblana, Torta de Tinga and a Torta de Al pastor. The Jr size is a good size but the regular size is definitely when ur starving or want to share. The huaraches de carne asada are also tasty and of course you have to get a bottle Mexican soda to wash it down. Oh I can't forget the two salsas they bring you. I tried the red one which has a "rustic" salsa taste  which is great on everything. Heat wise I would say a 5 out of 10, 10 being habanero style. :) it's definitely a place to not skip for an awesome Torta and of course the neighborhood where this located is a great location to walk off the hearty meal; just saying.
author: Alonso M.

description: Came back and tried a large #12 pierna enchilada torta: it was indeed muy delicioso and way to big to eat in one sitting. As far as being the 2nd best sandwich in America, i would say that's highly debatable. But never the less, still very tasty and worth checking out.
author: Dylan B.

description:
Whoaa...best Torta I've had since my explorations all over Old Mexico.  Maybe even better. The bread...incredible. And, the filling is so authentic. I had the carne with cactus and cheese. Melty, greasy goodness for all sandwich lovers. 

I can't wait to bring friends to this spot. Oh, the service was very fast and friendly. Lovely spot.
author: Dusty B.

description:
We tried the piernas enchiladas and carnitas tortas. Both lacked seasoning and the piernas was too saucy, soaking through the bread quite quickly. The carnitas didn't have the crispy bits or seasoning we enjoy with say like the carnitas from La Tapatia in SSF. The tabletop salsas were good with three choices: smoky/sweet, red/spicy, and a fresh bright green one. They really added to the tortas. 

I do have to say the employees are friendly, although not too organized or efficient with seating and taking orders. Once our orders were taken, the food arrived relatively quickly. And it's nice to go in to a place in the Mission and have indoor (and private outdoor) seating.  

Maybe I would have enjoyed the torta recommended on the Serious Eats torta guide. . . But the two tortas we tried were underwhelming.
author: K. S.

description:
I got there just as the boss man and employee were unloading a fresh round of supplies. I worked at a restaurant for a year and recognized the low quality ingredients from Costco. Hey, not everyone goes for the higher quality ingredients, right? I accept that I am getting things with pesticides on em' from a lot of restaurants. By accept, I mean, not killing myself with worry over an inevitable fact. I was surprised that the prices were still so high. 

My friend really wanted this place even though it had all the makings of a less than stellar experience. We came into the busy restaurant and sat down on our own.  While we waited for a server, I saw a girl come in and grab a napkin to dab her ankle which had gotten cut, followed immediately by the bossman I had spotted earlier (I'm observant, okay?) telling her that she had to ask him for the use of 'that' napkin. She told him that she's a regular customer and neighbor but that only pissed him off more. I couldn't hear what he said back to her. She looked totally offended and stormed out of the restaurant without buying anything. I think she was just there to borrow the napkin. I guess she should have asked him if she could borrow one of his Costco napkins. I'm saying Costco because I know he got a good deal on bulk napkins.

All of this drama before my order was even taken? I decided to stick around even though my friend not noticing any of this and gabbing away about her favorite stuff was making me reconsider my choice in company. The server came to take our order with a mediocre zest for customer service but with a boss like that, I felt more sorry for her than anything. I ordered the roasted poblano peppers with a side of rice and beans. They really messed up the rice, the flavor tasted like it was from a box. The cheesy beans were legit, I was going to cry for Argentina if they didn't get that right. The peppers were okay, but they didn't inspire me to write a review hiding the bad attitude I had witnessed. 

My friend went on and on about how good it was. She hadn't noticed anything the entire time but I can't say I'm surprised, she also told me that she eats at McDonald's sometimes, too. **Ouch** In the end, I just had to drop her as a friend for being irritatingly self-absorbed with very bad taste.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Sorry, Dynamo. Torta Gorda serves the best breakfast on the block, whether it's an avocado-studded chorizo scramble, or a giant goblet of fresh-squeezed mango juice blended in ice, or the unconquerable-in-a-single-sitting tortas themselves. 

It's a good thing they don't do donuts.
author: Liz C.

description: Great wat=y to start off morning meetings in the city!  Breakfast torta was very good. glad i got the JR size, because with the regular I would of had to go back to bed!  Great location in the Mission.  not far from BART now that i think about it.  Can't wait to get back here again.
author: The Fredster G.

description:
Not bad. The bread is what really makes a torta... and the bread was aiiiiiite. I ordered the Tinga Torta, which was "onion and chipotle sauce" but it had more of a tomato/acid-y sauce flavor. Fresh cut cheese slice inside, good flavor and large portions esp for the "Jr" size. My friend ordered the chilaquiles and that was just aiiiite also. 

BUT let me tell you... the GREEN SALSA IS SO FREAKING AMAZING. Perfect spiciness, flavor, acid, YUM. I asked for some of it to-go with my leftovers and basically drank the salsa.

Service sucked, but it it's the mission district.
author: Alex R.

description: Daaaaaamn. These are some tasty sandwiches that live up to the hype. They taste as good as they look in the pictures. Great service. Horchata. Do it.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Thought I would try the tortas here instead of walking a bit more down the street for Los picudos. Basically I should have kept waking. It was a bit over $7 for a junior chicken torta. Too much! There was really no flavor. It had no tomatoes or lettuce yet it had beans :/ 
It was really underwhelming. I'm actually being generous with three stars but since I only tried the torta I thought that would be fair. I was pretty disappointed. So far no one can beat los picudos!
author: shawna d.

description:
* 4.5 stars *

I get excited easily.

When the brilliant Patty P came up with the idea of getting together for lunch so we can cross off another item on the Big Eat SF list, I wanted to respond with something cool, but can only come up with "YAY!"

On the 7 x 7 list is:

#39 Pierna Enchilada from La Torta Gorda

I love how this place is casual and homey.  Spanish music playing in the background, there's counter seating available, fresh juices in their big containers on your left when you walk in.

I was sipping on my sweet cantaloupe juice while looking at the menu and noticed that a lot of the names are in Spanish.  (you know this place has got to be authentic) Our server was more than happy to help us with the translation.

Patty and I dug into that delicious Chile Relleno ($9.45) served with rice and beans. It was stuffed with (cotija?) cheese and swimming in tasty sauce!  Tortillas are provided with this dish so you can sop up the saucy goodness.  The rice and bean portions are on the smaller side. (or maybe I'm just so used to seeing rice and beans that fill up half my plate?)

That torta was akin to a sammy, but this one didn't leave me hungry two hours later. It must be from the avocado, refried beans, queso freso, mayo , onions and jalapeno that filled the torta.  The tender pork just pulled everything together. I now think that torta translates to "so good" in English. Get the junior size for $5.45 and it's enough to tide you over til the next meal. 

If the affordable prices and the good food here don't get you excited, then you my friend, are just hopeless.
author: Janice C.

description: I loved the bread! Best tortas ever!!!! The services is good too. The chicken is the best I ever had at a Mexican spot.The lady who helped me was very sweet.
author: Manjit S.

description:
This place is one of my 24th Street favorites. The tortas are all pretty solid but the China Poblana and the Al Pastor are both so savory and decadent, I always come back for more. The woman who runs the place always greets me like a neighbor (and i am) but I don't get this from the other spots in my patch of SF. It is true as another review points out that many of their ingredients come from Costco as I have been there on delivery days as well. But my business shops at Costco too because they sell fairly high quality goods for the price. Costco actually does alot of local sourcing, that many food distributors don't so I think it is a shame to ding them for this. While I'd like to see local ingredients I know that comes with a higher price tag, I am willing to accept either as long as they serve delicious food at a fair price with a smile. They do all of this.

One other thing. I also like trotting out my Spanish from study abroad and she is very patient and helpful on keeping my Espanol tuned up. Nice plus.
author: Sean Q.

description: Very yummy cocina poblana. Try the Taco Placero or Quesadilla de flor de calabaza, my favorites. Very friendly service, good place for watching soccer games too.
author: Eduardo V.

description:
When I started going to La Torta Gorda... It was awesome!!!  fresh ingredients, great customer service, good prices, and clean. Unfortunately the place changed of owner and everything went down. The menu changed totally!!!!  the service people are not the same, even the "cashier" dresses and acts like a hooker with the customers.   I went to get 3 tortas to go and while they made them we sat at the counter and watch the whole process which by the way they need to get better and clean that greasy range hood (drips grease).   When I saw that they didn't put tomato on them, I asked the cook if they didn't put that because a real traditional Mexican torta has tomato!!!  so he said that I wanted some he'll put it.  So.. after 35 minutes of waiting... they finally called my name to pay...  when I come to the cashier she tells me that it was $43 dollars for 3 tortas..  WTF????????   So I asked her why it was so high?  she said becuase It was a dollar each extra for the tomato,...  and I said... a dollar for two slices of tomato?  That's ridiculous!!!!   and this ASSHOLE!!!  who was standing there next to me at the register.. said:  They don't give me the tomatoes for free at the store.... And i asked... WHO ARE YOU? He said... the owner.   OMG!!!  really?  NO wonder why this place sucks now!!!  So I said.... I'm not asking you to give me nothing for free... but it's not fare to try to steal or rip off your customers.   So... I asked for my receipt and they said they didn't have receipts....  and I said... o.k. give me something in writing of what I paid.   He said to Hooker Cashier to give a business card...  really dude???  so.. I was a fan of this place.. Now...  NEVER COMING BACK!!!  

Have you guys tried tortas LOS PICUDOS?  They are soooo good!!! give them a try.
author: Karime C.

description: Great food !! I got the ham torta jr (no beans, no mayo, no cheese) and it was still on point. They give you a great amount of meat and a soft, crunchy bread to hold it in. Guaranteed to leave you satisfied!
author: Miguel H.

description:
When I found this place ten feet from my door I had high hopes for it's quality and authenticity. Upon checking the menu you'll find that there's a bigger torta theme than most Mission locations, and there is good reason for that. Their sandwich selection is very good and you can't go wrong by choosing your favorite meat torta and calling it. The JR size is usually enough to fill you up but I always get the full size and save half for later. 

Adding avocado and other customizations can increase the bill somewhat but overall they've got very reasonable pricing. Sit down and enjoy the classic atmosphere which combines old school diner with classier Mexican decor than most places on 24th street. 

This isn't El Farolito; it's a place that you can have coffee with your breakfast (the chilaquiles are delish) and actually spend some extended time in a comfortable setting. The service has always been top notch and it's full of Mission locals who know where to get authentic cuisine.

Highly recommended.
author: Sean K.

description: This Mexican here approves la torta cubana and la torta de tinga. I've had authentic ones in my life, but these are pretty good. Probably the best you can find in the mission.
author: Oskar D.

description: Nom nom nom :) The food at this place was awesome! I had the pierna echilada torta, which was really delicious, although a bit messy to eat because of the sauce or something. I also had a pina colada which was, to my surprise, much larger than I expected and very good. The service was very friendly and sitting out on the patio in the sun was just an added bonus
author: Bianca C.

description: La Torta Gorda is excellent.  There is an incredible variety of food - tortas, sandwiches (American style), Poblano dishes (like the giant Taco placero), breakfast (my favorite!), juices, smoothies and it is all really tasty.  Ingredients are fresh and the services is good, though it can get super packed on weekends.  I highly recommend La Torta Gorda if you are in the neighborhood.
author: John H.

description:
The best torta I've ever had!  Simply amazing!  I ordered the torta mega cubana here and it was huge and delicious!  Homemade bread and salsas.  At least I think the bread is homemade.  Wash it down with a hot champurrada and go into hibernation for a week until you're hungry again!  

This place is as good as it gets when it comes to tortas.  Amazing!
author: Billy H.

description: Used to be my favorite spot for Mexican breakfast foods. Seems that they have jumped the pricing and made their foods pretty American. Flavorless and pricey. $13 for rancheros- watery flavorless sauce poured over canned vegetables and mushy rice with eggs. Sad.
author: David B.

description:
Do you miss huitlacoche?  I did, until some lovely friends introduced me to this spot.  Their quesadillas de huitlacoche really hit the spot, as do the homemade salsas.  The interior is also old-school Mission, unchanged from its days as a diner.  I hope it never gets re-furbished, but keeps serving the same yummy food.
And if you don't know, huitlacoche is a fungus which grows on corn and is really yummy.
author: Aileen J.

description: Ok this place delivers once you find YOUR dish. My personal favorites have been the chicken tinga quesadilla, the chilaquiles dish (wow!), the omelet (so good!), and i recently discovered that their guacamole will KNOCK YOUR SOCKS OFF! I'm not like an expert in Mexican food but I'm guessing not every dish is for everyone. Like I got weirded out about cactus and I've seen some of the sandwiches and they don't seem like my thing. But like I said there's something for everyone and they do a great job! The chilaquiles is SOOO good and so much better than the chilaquiles next door! :-)
author: Brian B.

description:
Pretty impressive menu.  Great service and great food.

It wasn't busy when we were there, and I"m surprised because this place rocks.  I had the torta al pastor, and it was perfect!  The bread was awesome, the al pastor was great, and then there was avocado and pineapple.  It was delicious.

Go there now.  Eat and thank me later.
author: Nelson W.

description:
No wonder the Pierna Enchilada Torta made the 7x7 Big Eat list!  That thing was a monster and oh so AMAZING!  I ordered the junior size but was only able to finish half since it was SO large.  It was packed with carnitas, cheese, pickled jalapenos, onions, and sauce.  The guy working the register brought it out to me with a squeeze bottle of deliciously smoky salsa that I liberally used on every bite.

The place is tiny, but they have a great patio in the back with tables and umbrellas.  The guys working there are some of the friendliest, most helpful around!
author: Vicente G.

description: Yum! It was delicious! The waitress was helpful with my bf and I. We ordered french toast, a jr. carne asada, regular cubana, and tinga. I can't speak on the last two tortas but I must say that my carne aside torta, was great. Light, not heavy, the carne.. was seasoned well. It was cool. Jr. Size looks like the size of a Mc Chicken sandwich, maybe a tad bit bigger? Perfect for a lunch or an easy small dinner. The green sauce was great! If you like spicy, you'll love. This was on the mark of almost being too spicy for me to enjoy, but I was able to manage. I'll be back bc they serve bfast all day and take debit.
author: Sweets N.

description: It's good but def not the best sand which around the bay. Price is decent and portions are big. I only came here to try the #2 best rated sandwhich on foodnetwork.
author: Reginald A.

description: Nice carne asada torta. Great lunch. Love the long counter and diner vibe. Patio seating in back. I want to come back for breakfast.
author: James B.

description:
Words cannot express how amazing the tortas here are!!! It was just... incredible. The best I've ever had.

What's more is that not only is this an incredible gastronomic experience, its a superb, local, mom and pop place. I'm pretty sure it doesn't get more authentic than this. Oh SO GOOD!
author: Madeleine T.

description:
La Torta Gorda offers one of the best tortas I've ever had.

The large Pierna Enchilada Torta was indeed the size of my face!  The crispy torta bread was surprisingly able to withstand the massive amount of saucy pork and gooey avocado, giving my hands a mess-free path to maneuver the beastly torta.  The torta was rich in flavors, and each bite caused me to momentarily close my eyes in satisfaction.  Although I am rarely forced to save leftovers, I could only handle half of the torta due to its enormity.  

Will definitely be back to try another torta!
author: Andrew M.

description:
the best Quesadillas ever! Authentic Mexico Mexican food - my pal from D.F. brought me there - if you're in need of some serious help - get the Vampira!
some serious fresh squeezed juice!
author: Music L.

description:
Man that was a long wait for a sandwich, I don't recommend coming in for lunch for a to go order unless you feel like waiting for a while.

But about the torta, I ordered the mega cubana and the sandwich was delicious. Their Milanesa isn't very good but everything else stood out pretty well. The bread is 10x more delicious than other tortas in the area but it doesn't hold up with a lot of stuff, so don't expect to be able to eat too big a torta on this bread. The junior is already pretty big, I don't recommend the regular unless you're a big guy.

Honestly, this place is pretty damn good.
author: Rohan D.

description:
I bought the breaded carne asade torta.  A bit on the pricey side.

The crispiness of the bread was on point as they grill it panini style.  All of the ingredients on the inside were very fresh.  However, each bite was quite dry as I had to overload it with the green sauce that was at the table.  Each bite wasn't that flavorful.  Much like the taste of eating avocadoes and eggs.  If the meat in the torta was more flavorful and the overall sandwich was less dry, this sandwich could easily be 5 star worthy.
author: Timothy D.

description: I really like this place. But the prices are too high now!  15 dls for an enchilidas come on. 6 dls for a quesadilla.  And all the plates are around 13dls. I paying that in another places but the plates are big and I can share with my girl
author: Henry G.

description:
La Torta Gorda: You are my new favorite. Your delicious al pastor torta is a glorious mix of tangy marinated pork, crunchy pineapple chunks, and the perfect number of spicy jalapeños, which bejeweled the inside of my sandwich like twinkly ornaments on the gastronomic Christmas tree of my most beloved memory.

The counter is a lovely place to sit and wait for your sandwich, or just to enjoy one in person - even if you're there solo.

If you take your torta to go, they'll pack up a pot of chipotle salsa, so don't worry about missing out.

Logistical FYIs - Tax isn't included and the delivery minimum is now $25 according to the menu (not $20). The Pierna Enchilada torta is the 7x7 favorite (pulled pork), which both requires and plays nicely with the chipotle salsa. However, Al Pastor is more delicious and interesting here, and you should try that instead.
author: Megan G.

description: Poor customer service.  Waitress spent more time talking with her friends then helping customers.
author: randy t.

description:
This place was very cute-looking. Walked in noon-ish, and there were plenty of seats.

I split a Pollo and a Pierna Enchilada torta with a friend. They were both good, but in different ways.

The Pollo was really good and perfect for tasting every aspect of what was in the torta.  The meat wasn't overly seasoned, so you could actually taste to avocado, beans and everything.

The Pierna Enchilada was good, but I got more of a texture of everything (other than the onion, which is really too strong to mask with anything).  

Both torta's were made very well, and the crispy bun outside was DELICIOUS.  It didn't get soggy, and just was all around amazing. 

The service was ok, The woman was very nice. But it wasn't busy and she gave us far too much time for everything. Took a long time getting us the menu's, and the check.  I'd give it 3.5 stars, and normally round down to 3 because service is huge for me.  But the food was delicious, and I saw the waitress a little faster with other people. So maybe my table just looked slow. ha.
author: Lily W.

description: Went in to try something new. La Torta Gorda did not disappoint. The #29 Huaraches plate was delicious.  We also tried #21 China Poblana and #19 Rajas de queso. Was neat to sit outside at their back patio. Who knew? The mango smoothie hit the spot.
author: C U.

description:
Good food! Suuper slow service, the kitchen crew takes soo long so te restaurant is always full of people waiting for their food. They also need at least one more waitress; i ordered a simple coffee and my niece an orange juice woth completely separated pulp from juice (sitting on the counter for a while) 

Managment needs to step up and do something, they have good quality plates but customer service need a lot of help.
author: Edwin R.

description:
Very similar to an Italian panini, I find their  Torta a very refreshing change from the usual  deli sandwiches. Located in the 24th street corridor in the heart of the Mission, this place is a very classic small neighborhood eatery which is run by awesome young crew. 

My first time here, I had to indulge on the Pierna Enchilada (pulled pork) torta filled with re-fried beans, avocado, queso fresco, onions, mayo, & jalapenos. The large version is plenty to feed two! Definitely splatter this torta with the hot sauce for a real treat, spicy in a good way.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
Standing at the doorway, we are greeted with cheers & hollers. No, the celebratory exuberance was not for us (I wish!) but for the World Cup game playing on their TV (MEX & FRA, i think? Not sure, since I don't follow the sports.) 

The narrow diner has counter seating to the left & tables (that seat four) to the right. There's something very comfortable about La Torta Gorda; I don't know if it's the warm service or the open kitchen or even the familiar food, but I liked the easy going, laid back feel. 

I ordered the junior sized chicken milanese torta, which was big enough to share with my lunch partner (who had a quesadilla with huitlachoche, basically a mushroom & corn filling that she said was great.) 

I think if I'd ordered a more traditional Mexican meat (like carne asada), I would have enjoyed my torta more. The breaded chicken would have been good at an Italian restaurant, but I can't say it belonged in a torta. Also, I would have liked different textures in my sammy (something crispy, please.) I did appreciate the spice level from the jalapenos.

While I won't be a regular at LTG, I don't hesitate to recommend it. Their simple food & wallet friendly prices ($11 for lunch!) seem to be crowd pleasers. On to the next torta joint!
author: Fancypants X.

description: I've had amazing tortas in the city.. This was not one of them. If I have to season it at home myself, then I could have just made it too. I had such hope for my Cubana that barely delivered :( The service however, its great. Service with a smile is always appreciated :)
author: Miss E.

description: I was expecting something really good and I had something not really tasty. There is a lot of good Mexican restaurant in SF and this one was recommanded by a friend as one of the best. Maybe just not for my palate. I'm looking forward to back there and change this review.
author: Mathieu F.

description:
It was a Saturday. My friends and I came to SF to buy some mochi from Chinatown, then we wanted some tortas. Thank you Yelp for this place when we were searching!

The tortas were super good! They were like the ones in Mexico; it came with the meat, onions, avocado, refried beans, and jalapenos. It did not disappoint at all!

Totally coming back whenever I'm near the Mission for sure!
author: Terri L.

description:
Everyone needs to come here and try a torta! 

The torta really is gorda! (That means plump right?) For about 8 bucks, you can get a large torta which is the perfect amount to share between 2 people.  So the first THUMBS UP goes to this place being cheap, affordable and a good deal!

Also, the food there was just really really good. I kept looking at my pierna enchilada torta, trying to figure out exactly what was in it.  Amazing deliciousness, sort of like an Ike's equivalent of a torta.  That's a second THUMBS UP.

Third THUMBS UP goes to this place having great service.  The man who served us was so friendly, even though he never spoke a word of English to me.   I would definitely come back here again for more more moAR tortas!
author: Gloria C.

description:
Love the old school diner look, open kitchen, counter seating, booths - and the Mexican menu combined with some diner standbys like pancakes, egg dishes and omelettes.  The Mexican menu includes their famous tortas, tacos, chilaquiles, and quesadillas. For beverages, choose from fresh squeezed juice, coffee, and Mexican sodas.

Tortas come in two sizes, junior and regular - the juniors are mostly $5.45 and the larger size is $7.75.  

* Piernas enchilada torta - it sounds like an enchilada but it's actually a torta.  The torta starts with grilled, soft, thick bread, and it's filled with savory pulled pork, refried beans, avocado, queso fresco, jalapenos, onions and mayo.  The bread soaks up the juices.  It's warm, flavorful and creamy - but too saucy and a bit soggy.  I like a little more textural contrast in my sandwiches.  I had the junior size and it's smaller than what I'm used to - but most tortas are probably too large.
author: Lolia S.

description: I have always wanted to try this place and was very excited to see how it was. Well my excitement turned to a huge disappointment pretty quick. I ordered the chicharron en salsa verde, I assumed it was going to be crispy with sauce poured over. When I received my plate it was soft limp fat in salsa, no meat at all on the chicharron, and very little of it. The price was $12.95,. Are you frickin kidding me,  your gonna charge that much for a few pieces of fat with some sauce poured over it. The waitress noticed that I didn't like my plate and asked me if I wanted something else. At this time no, was hugely disappointed. My husband ordered the huarache with carne asada and it was loaded with nopales, no where on the menu did it state that. I assumed she was going to take my order off the check because she saw I didn't eat it at all. Well she didn't and I asked her you are still going to charge me for that dish and she said yes because that is how we prepare that dish. If I could give this place 0 stars I would have but Yelp won't let you. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE, NOR WILL I EVER STEP FOOT IN THERE AGAIN.
author: Ronette B.

description:
Delicious gut-busting tortas galore! Best Puebla eats in SF with a cute back patio area to boot. Don't miss it! Check out this review for more details: 
http://www.travelsages.com/2013/10/30/authentic-puebla-eats-at-la-torta-gorda/
author: Anna P.

description:
So, my bucket list has always had one constant : Sample every "must-do" restaurant of a city. 
La Torta Gorda caught my eye on the Eater 38 list (the 38 essential SF restaurants), so I obviously had to try it.
After a whole morning of intense working out on a Saturday, my stomach was in knots because of hunger pangs, so I head over to La Torta Gorda.
Now first, a little detour, about this neighborhood : I've been living in the mission for 2 years now, and I still haven't explored this part! Its like a whole micro neighborhood within the mission, and its so much more "mission". Gone are the hipsters, bring in the authentic mexican restaurants, spanish being thrown around everywhere, mexican grocery stores, the complete package.
La Torta Gorda is a little Mexican Diner (and this is a legit diner, complete with bar stools, greasy food, tv screens and beer) that has a small list of city-famous Tortas.
Now, the only reason why this place gets 4 stars instead of 5 : Since I was hungry and wanted to try everything : I went with the "everything torta". Whilst most of the meat in this was great, and the buns were perfectly buttered and crisped, the sausage was a GIANT MISS. The sausage in this torta was MOST DEFINITELY NOT needed. So my only tip when you go here : Get any torta without sausage, and you'll come out stuffed and smiling

Tip: Their portions are GIGANTIC. The full size torta is enough for 1.5 people, in other words, the full size torta ALMOST fills my stomach.
author: Aabhas S.

description: I have been a customer of this fabulous for 11 years, sadly last friday was the last time I come in, as prices have sore,  impossible for locals to afford. I wish them the best, but I can get the exact same food for a 1/3 of the price near by.
author: Gabby L.

description:
We ordered Guacamole & Chips and the Pierna Enchilada Torta to share.

The Guacamole was fresh and unexpectedly spicy.....in a good way. The flavor of the torta was delicious, however adding some of the guacamole to it made it much better. Which means, on it's own the torta would have been missing something. There were avocados tucked inside, however I don't think there was enough.

The bread was crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside; perfect ends to contain the torta innards. To me, the bread is a very important component of a torta and La Torta Gorda gets it right.

Overall their torta was good, one of the better ones I've eaten in the city. However, since our guac made it much better, I'm a little undecided if it was the perfect package. However, I'd be willing to return and give another torta a chance.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Yum yum. Best al pastor in the Mission, service friendly. Tortas are huge. Tip to budding Messiahs: with five of their tortas, you probably could feed 5,000 people.
author: Faceless E.

description:
If you want a filling, coma inducing, feast of a sandwich... the super mega cubana or whatever it was called is exactly what you want.

you know when you have those cravings that no matter what you have in your fridge or where you go to eat you are still unsatisfied and feel like blah... 

well, this place- if you order the mega cubana full size- is precisely what your liver needs to recover from a night out in the mission, on a mission haha

in other perspectives, they offer a large variety of tortas and the bread holds very good. they take your order and present it to you exactly as you ask it.

Carl's jr. commercials meet your reality! mmmmmmm
author: Leo M.

description:
They close at 8PM so it was totally cool of them to keep the place open for us and let us lounge around even though we rolled in at 7:45.  Plus they were super helpful with the menu and actually told us to get a smaller size.

Pierna Enchilada Torta + Chorizo & Egg Torta - the junior size is a good portion
Caldo de pollo - they were nice enough to split the soup for us and we both got a large piece of chicken in our bowls and it's serve with a side of diced onions, cilantro, jalapenos and limes.
Champurrado - a hot chocolate mixed with corn...super rich and yummy
author: Jen C.

description: I nearly did it. I nearly put away an entire regular-size al pastor torta, that was the size of a newborn baby. And I had a cantaloupe agua fresca. And I sat out in the back patio because it was nice out. The sandwich was good, not amazing, but I'm pretty sure I'll be back.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Overpriced, flavorless, food network not accurate. This place will not take you to flavor town.
author: Clarissa C.

description:
I did enjoy the Al Pastor torta and it was a great size as well. I'm not a huge torta eater so this was a change of pace for me. I found it interesting and quite similar to the panini served at Italian places. 

it's a pretty decent little spot on 24th street and the ambience is nice. I guess I'm not certain if I'd go back or not. I probably should and just get something different. Overall, I liked the meal, pricing, and ambience. Nothing mind blowing, but a good experience.
author: Nick E.

description: Tried their huitlacoche quezadillas at the SF Street Food Fest 2012. The tortilla was good and crispy, and the huitlacoche/corn/cheese as the filling were pretty good too and it all worked really well together. It was my first time trying huitlacoche, it wasn't bad! Would definitely want to try some of the other stuff here if I'm in the neighborhood again.
author: Sophie Y.

description: Amazing cocina poblana. Every time I'm in town, la torta gorda is one of my favorite places to eat. Simply delicious!
author: Ernesto I.

description: The food here is overpriced for the quality-- you can get everything they serve, better and cheaper, within a blocks walk of this place. The service was terrible. They got me my food pretty quickly, but then they pointed to some silverware holders and said, "Oh yeah, silverware is over there." Guess I'm getting it myself. The coffee was some of the worst I've ever tasted. I'm assuming the guy running the cash register was the manager. He got mad that some employees left something out on the counter and, to show his displeasure, decided to start slamming things down on the counter. Passive aggressive much? Breakfast cost me over $15 bucks and totally wasn't worth it.
author: P U.

description:
You know how Italians won't go to a place if the minestrone soup is sub-par? I had a friend for a while, Antonio-Something-Sexy-Sounding, who could like everything about an Italian resaurant, but if the soup was no good the restaurant got no love from Antonio. None. Nada. Nien. Here is a clip of one of our conversations: 

Me: Hey, I'm hungry. And I want Italian. And don't throw in some remark about you being Italian and how I can have you. I want Italian food. Not you, the Italian. 

ASSS: Me, too. 

Me: How 'bout that little place on 18th street? I hear it's got a killer gnochi. 

ASSS: No. 

Me: Wha? Why? It's supposed to be fantastic. 

ASSS: I won't go dere. Da soup sucks balls. 

Me: So don't get the soup. 

ASSS: I can't NOT get da soup. 

Me: You're irritating. 

ASSS: No, I'm Italian! **throws hands in the air** I can't just go to an Italian restaurant and not get da soup! **Keeps hands in the air and stares at me with challenge**

Me: Yes you can. You're being dramatic. 

ASSS: Dere's just some tings you can't look past! It's like seeing a beautiful woman, and den noticing she has a mustache. She's not beautiful anymore. Same with da soup. It makes the place. And dat place is like a girl with a mustache. 

Me: (Silence)

ASSS: (Staring) 

Me:  Fine. How about the place on Valencia we went to a couple months ago? Or is that place like a beautiful mustachioed woman, too? 

ASSS: No. That's a true beautiful lady. We can go there. 

Me: You're buying. 

Anyway ... that's how I am about salsa. I'm a self-admitted salsa-snob. And I like it HOT!
